result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin J Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act. [Modifiers: Penalty-Force Child to View Sex. Conduct], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall remain the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------------------

Obtain and maintain full time employment or school.
-----------------------------------------

No contact with victim M.A.S. No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without Agent's permission, except for supervised contact with his siblings and with the Agent's approval.
-----------------------------------------

Obtain a sex offender assessment and follow through with treatment. Enter into and complete any counseling ordered by Agent. Register with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program and follow all rules of the registry program. Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees as directed.
-----------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before December 18, 2015 at 8:00 a.m. with work release privileges.
